text:
I was redirected here directly by your team member from your website. He told me that developer support is only here in the HubSpot Slack and that is the only way I can contact you ...so hopefully it is correct.

Hey guys, I am having an issue with my application and I am kinda stuck now. So I have an public OAuth2 connection since I am a product manager at <http://Boost.space|Boost.space> and just to simplify we are something like <http://Make.com|Make.com> and Zapier (saying that so you understand it is not me who is using the application and it is not for personal use-cases).

I do have many scopes in place and I believe that all of them should be approved...unfortuntely once I am trying to make a connection or one of our clients that uses <http://Boost.space|Boost.space> and HubSpot it gives us an error.

Do you have any idea what I need to adjust?

Thank you in advance guys.
Working as Expected <@U01GW2U4WMA> :raised_hands:
hey justin! this requires an enterprise subscription for any hub

Has anyone had much success using the goals api to find out who a goal is assigned to? The documentation lists out a few properties, but in the single object report builder, there are a lot of other properties in use. Wanted to see if anyone else had figured this out before I start taking guesses at what these properties are called.
Hi, i'm looking for some help to troubleshoot some discrepancies between data i'm seeing in the API vs the front end UI.
Im seeing company associations in the UI, while the data on the back end of deal-company-associations is not showing up

These needed to be fetched in your request.

Show me the API call you are making to fetch the object records
Just so I understand, you have a workflow which is triggered via webhook?

Yes, that's correct. I have a workflow that is triggered via a webhook. My goal is to send the internal name of a selected input property, specifically `propertyName`, to the endpoint. However, instead of just sending the value, I need to capture and send the internal name of the property.
I’m not sure how to adjust the payload or the function to achieve this. Could you guide me on how I can modify the current setup to include the internal name?
Thanks in advance for your help!
The payload you are sending is confusing....Why is it structured like this?
Are you trying to create a "custom coded action" via API call?
Please share with me details on how you ended up with the payload structure you are sending in Postman - that would help significantly.

Yes, I'm trying to create a "custom coded action" via an API call. The payload I shared is part of my attempt to define the action, including the input and output fields, and the function that handles the webhook.
What's the use case? It's way easier to build the coded action using the UI
basically its create  the workflow action like this  and send the property value in the action url (webhookUrl: '*****'). But  i want the internal name of these property.
I'm sorry - I still feel like I missing something.
The internal name of a property is found inside the HubSpot Object properties
but if you need the internal name dynamically, you need to create the proprty via API or fetch it
is it possible to fetch while i'm using workflow?
Inside the custom coded action itself you can make GET requests
Right now you are using Postman - what service is going to end up running this code?
Hello I am looking for help on creating an API integration between HubSpot and <http://app.recruitbot.com|app.recruitbot.com> - can someone help provide instructions here?
Hi <@U06LU432THN>, I can connect you with the Sequences PM over email! Would you mind sending me your email :slightly_smiling_face:
That’s very open ended. What specifically would you like to achieve first?

We have a form on the app side --<https://app.recruitbot.com/accounts/signup/free-trial> where I would like HS to capture the data when the form gets submitted. The form is currently not tracked in HubSpot.
i'm using a data integration vendor Hevo that i believe is using the v3 API
i went down the support path and the guidance i got was this:
That sounds like a Hevo issue

HubSpot response: Thank you for your time, Kevin. Indeed, I can see that the association between the deal record [redacted] and the companies [redacted] and [redacted] took place via API as expected as you can see here. It looks like the association might have missed a parameter to update the Deal-Company association field, Kevin. Unfortunately, when it comes to API management, as chat support reps, since we are not developers, we don't have access to troubleshoot how the association could be made on the backend to update that information. To be transparent and guide you to the right place, in this case, you could consult our <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers|HubSpot developer forum>, this is a site monitored by HubSpot developers who would be better able to advise on custom code and APIs, both HubSpot and external developers are extremely active, and it is the fastest and most accurate resource for any custom coding queries! There is also a<https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack| Slack channel >for developers where you can also get assistance from our developers :slightly_smiling_face: There you will find all the necessary data to inspect the API integration you are working on, Kevin

the interesting thing is when i put in the deal id in the HubSpot UI search, it shows the deal and 2 columns: deal->contact and deal->company, it has correct values in contact association and i see it in the back end. the deal->company column is null on the UI . its when i click into the deal that i can see the company associations on the right panel
I'm not familiar with Hevo so it depends on how this application is fetching data
i'm working on a different thread to evaluate the whether its a hevo pipeline thing, but it doesn't seem to be any missing events.
looking at the history of association, there were companies that were deleted /merged and my hypothesis is that process may be messing up with associations from front end to back end
i've experienced a similar problem with discrepancies from backend to frontend with contact to company associations on merges

You could do this by the following:
1. Create a form within HubSpot with the fields you want to match the free-trial fields up to.
2. Create an Private App within your HubSpot Account.
    a. Add the forms scope.
3. Using this Token (from the private app), You can send that data via the API to this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/marketing/forms/v3-legacy#submit-data-to-a-form-supporting-authentication|endpoint>.

Hi Vit, its hard to know without more specific information about:

1. Your public app's current authorization scope configuration
2. The full install url you are providing to your customers
3. The tier/subscriptions of your customer's portal
4. The permissions/role of the user trying to install your application in their portal
Ultimately these error messages are the result of a discrepancy between a couple or mulitple of the above. Happy to provide any further details I can over a private message if you are able to provide more information.
Hello! Is there any plans on enabling the search API to search for "archived" records?

hello everyone, i want to use the query param..for api want to access the particular properties only...as accessing the whole data and filtering through code taking time, I wonder HubSpot must have provided with advance filter through api as well. ..
GET : <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/deals>
I got this:
{
    "results": [
{
            "updatedAt": "2024-07-04T10:21:45.878Z",
            "createdAt": "2024-07-04T10:21:45.878Z",
            "name": "add_to_dnc",

            "dataSensitivity": "non_sensitive"
        },]}
i want my deals to filter out with add_to_dnc = true as in the interface using advance filter, I want to do it using query param to access faster.
On GET : <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?properties=dealname,country_of_client,section,office,add_to_dnc>
I got the data of deals with specified properties, but i want the data with these properties whose add_to_dnc is true. Help me out as this is taking a lots of time, and I am very new to this API, I tried to look on docs but didn't find out.
Can you give the Search API endpoint a try: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/objects/deals#search>
